required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MRI of Infrapatellar Fat Pad in Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging of Infrapatellar Fat Pad in Osteoarthritis and Controls

lead_sponsor.agency: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

clinical_study.source: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators use the clinical documentation and imaging data of MRI to do research. Clinical subjects were divided into two groups: osteoarthritis patients and healthy controls without osteoarthritis. Differences of MRI data were studied between two groups.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigators applied high precision MRI technique (with as less as a slice thickness of 0.35 mm and without inter-slice gap), and calculated not only the IPFP maximal sagittal area and IPFP volume, but also the quantitated signal, and compared the differences between healthy controls and osteoarthritis patients. This is an observational cross-sectional study without specific interventions to the subjects. MRI is a regular examination in our hospital. And all subjects are included for the reasons of osteoarthritis (need MRI) and healthy controls (pain but not osteoarthritis, also need MRI). The investigator does not assign specific interventions to the subjects of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Infrapatellar Fat Pad Volume in MRI
primary_outcome.time_frame: collect the data within 24 hours after the subjects did the MRI

arm_group.description: 3.0 Tesla Magnetic resonance imaging was analyzed. It's the documentation from the outpatients and inpatients with osteoarthritis. It's not the intervention the study applied, but the subjects' disease demands.

3.0 Tesla Magnetic resonance imaging was analyzed. It's the documentation from the outpatients and inpatients without osteoarthritis. It's not the intervention the study applied, but the subjects' non-osteoarthritis knee symptom demands.

intervention.description: 3.0 T Magnetic resonance imaging of knee joints. It does not harm the subjects.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who come to see doctors requiring knee MRI test.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Orthopaedic Surgery, Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

reference.citation: Pan F, Han W, Wang X, Liu Z, Jin X, Antony B, Cicuttini F, Jones G, Ding C. A longitudinal study of the association between infrapatellar fat pad maximal area and changes in knee symptoms and structure in older adults. Ann Rheum Dis. 2015 Oct;74(10):1818-24. doi: 10.1136/annrheumdis-2013-205108. Epub 2014 May 15.

Han W, Aitken D, Zhu Z, Halliday A, Wang X, Antony B, Cicuttini F, Jones G, Ding C. Signal intensity alteration in the infrapatellar fat pad at baseline for the prediction of knee symptoms and structure in older adults: a cohort study. Ann Rheum Dis. 2016 Oct;75(10):1783-8. doi: 10.1136/annrheumdis-2015-208360. Epub 2015 Nov 26.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
